name: DoubleTree by Hilton Austin - University Area

reviews.text: Yowsers...this place needs a cosmetic and management makeover!!!
reviews.title: Whoa!!!

reviews.text: The outside of the building is gorgeous and interesting. The inside looks like it is straight out of the 80's!!! The rooms/suites are nice and spacious, however, there is so much wasted space in the rooms. The furniture in the rooms is worn out and the layouts just don't make a whole lot of sense. The hallways are beyond hot and there is only 1 bank of elevators in the hotel. The hotel is set up like a square with the middle cut out. If you are not staying near the elevator bank then you have to walk the length of the "square" to get to the elevator.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the Double Tree name

reviews.text: The employees were just...odd. I can't say they weren't nice...just odd. For example: One morning we walked down to breakfast and told the host "2 please". He responded with "You want a table?". We responded with "Uh, yes, for 2 please.". He says nothing further to us and waives for us to follow him. He walks us to a table and points to it. The waitress says something to him and he waives his hand at us as if saying no and points to another table. We ask him "You want us to sit here?". He points again to the table and walks off. OKEY DOKEY...very strange. Our odd encounters at this place are just too numerous to mention in this review. However, the waitress at breakfast...I believe her name was Mary Lee or Mary Lou???...heard our complaints and did her best to make up for the strange customer service we had been receiving. She mentioned they were overbooked, undertrained, and busy.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't think I will be returning to this hotel, even if the staff gets retrained and the interior receives a makeover!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel close enough to downtown Austin

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights to watch the high school state track meet. We chose this hotel because it is walking distance to Mike Myers stadium at UT. With three teenagers staying with us, we were looking forward to the emenities to keep our teens busy in the evenings. To our disapointment, the swimming pool was closed during our stay, the 'pay preview' movie selection was inoperable and the Wi-Fi in our room wasn't working. It was frusterating for us and our three teens that the couldn't watch movies, get on the internet or swim. They were bored to tears in the evening and after long hot days we would have enjoyed some peace and quiet in our room while the kids stayed preoccupied.
reviews.title: A very disappointing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hesitated to book this hotel, based on reviews we had read on Tripadvisor. We found it to be very clean, friendly, quiet, comfortable and convenient to our activities, the University of Texas commencement celebrations. Apparently some of the past reviews were written prior to an upgrade of the hotel's facilities. Our room had new furnishings, bathroom fixtures, a 32" digital TV, and at least 10 convenience outlets for powering or charging electronic devices.
reviews.title: Much better than other reviews would indicate

reviews.text: The hotel does NOT charge for parking. Reviewers who said that they do must have been reviewing a different hotel, perhaps the Doubletree in downtown Austin. Parking was always available even with the great influx of people for the commencement activities.
reviews.title: Fix your wifi

reviews.text: The hotel is located directly across the freeway from the Erwin Center where the individual college comments are held. It was an easy 5 minute walk over a bridge with traffic lights to stop the traffic while we crossed the feeder roads.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL WITH GREAT STAFF!

reviews.text: The Staff was very helpful. They maintain a file of Google map directions to most of the places of interest in Austin. There is also a (free) computer terminal in the lobby for finding information on local restaurants and points of interest. The separate business center charges a fee for computer use, but Internet access is free if you use your own computer.
reviews.title: Best Value, Minus Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never heard any noise from the freeway. Our room was not directly facing the road nor was it on the opposite side. The HVAC system was quiet for a window mounted unit.
reviews.title: Convenient stay for downtown event

reviews.text: Pros: Newly updated interiors, good service and location.
reviews.title: Excellent value. Loudest AC Unit EVER.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Crazy loud AC unit. Seriously. Good thing I sleep like a rock. That could have just been my room, but I have no doubts if I wanted to change rooms the staff would be happy to do so.
reviews.title: Will definitely stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and staff are wonderful! The staff greeted us immediately, the room was in perfect condition, and even the room service was great! Great location, extremely close to campus and downtown!
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious. Very modern feel, though the lighting was a little dark, but reasonable. The lounge was comfortable and the place was quiet despite it's location on a highway. I would actually say the location was good since it's only a couple miles from downtown (figure $6 cab fare to 6th Street). The staff was superb and extremely friendly; they quickly responded to anything that came up during our stay.
reviews.title: Would not recommend this hotel because of customer service

reviews.text: When checking into the hotel asked if we could upgrade our room from a king suite to a room with 2 queen beds. The one hotel desk employee told us there were no queen bed rooms available. This was not true because I went on line and there were over 10 rooms available. Hotel staff did not tell us where the elevator was located nor were they helpful with answering other questions.
reviews.title: Renovations going on, but a good stay...

reviews.text: This hotel is in an good location proximate to the university. Be sure to know this is the "University Area" Doubletree as there a multiple Doubletree hotels in town and the cab drivers are easily confused.
reviews.title: Decent Location, Few Problems, But Good Service

reviews.text: The room was OK. I was on the highway side which led to more noise. In addition, I also experienced the noisy heater. I sleep like a rock so I had no problem but I can see how others would not sleep well. I recommend asking for a room away from the highway. A few minor problems in the room. First the clock wasn't set to the right time and I had to call maintenance to set it to the right time as you needed a screwdriver to open it up. The service was great as they came very quickly, but it was a small annoyance. In addition you could tell the room was worn as the sink had a big crack (totally functional and didn't leak) and the mirror frame was chipped.
reviews.title: Soooo Loud!

reviews.text: The service was great. We were traveling for business and the whole city shut down as we got one inch of snow. As the university was closed we had to re-arrange our plans and use a meeting room in the hotel. The staff, including the general manager were extremely helpful in providing us the room and getting it setup and ready extremely quickly.
reviews.title: great one night stay!

reviews.text: A tip for Austin that frustrated us. The cabs are very hard to find. We had to call multiple cab companies in order to get one on at least two occasions. If you need a cab call well in advance.
reviews.title: Just OK, but would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I recommend this hotel for those who need the location and aren't too fussy about the room.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

description: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Austin – University Area provides a homelike warmth, just a mile from downtown Austin. Our hotel is just across the street from the University of Texas and the Frank Erwin Center. The most centrally located hotel in Austin, we're only four blocks from the Texas State Capitol and within easy reach of many Austin attractions.
